publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1096 Mr Stewart Maxwell: BBC Survey-That the Parliament congratulates the BBC on its recent survey and notes that 77% of people in Scotland support a ban on smoking in public places; agrees that both smoking and second-hand smoke are responsible for widespread ill-health and 13,000 avoidable deaths in Scotland, disproportionately affecting those that live within the poorer constituencies of Scotland, and supports measures that will assist in reducing levels of smoking and exposure to passive smoking, including legislation to regulate smoking in enclosed premises.
S2M-1096 BBC Survey (lodged on 24 March 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Alex Neil*

S2M-1096 Mr Stewart Maxwell: BBC Survey-That the Parliament congratulates the BBC on its recent survey and notes that 77% of people in Scotland support a ban on smoking in public places; agrees that both smoking and second-hand smoke are responsible for widespread ill-health and 13,000 avoidable deaths in Scotland, disproportionately affecting those that live within the poorer constituencies of Scotland, and supports measures that will assist in reducing levels of smoking and exposure to passive smoking, including legislation to regulate smoking in enclosed premises. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Alex Neil
S2M-1096 BBC Survey (lodged on 24 March 2004) Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*
